In 2017, 23% of cases where a gun was transferred to a prohibited purchaser involved someone who has been convicted of domestic violence or who had a restraining order. 

We must fix the #CharlestonLoophole to keep these weapons from falling into the wrong hands! #HR1112 pic.twitter.com/gXZX7xf0ao

The #CharlestonLoophole allows someone to purchase a firearm even if their background check has not been completed within the 3-day period. This is dangerous and allows people with criminal backgrounds and mental illnesses to become gun owners. #HR1112 pic.twitter.com/Jfq8F68hYw

In 2017, 6,004 background checks were denied after the initial 3-day waiting period. #HR1112 would allow the FBI more time to run background checks so we can stop prohibited gun owners from slipping through the cracks.
